abstract: Advertisers distributed more than 272 billion coupons in free-standing inserts in 2011, according to a report from Kantar Media, a decline of 6.5 percent from 2010.
snippet: Advertisers distributed more than 272 billion coupons in free-standing inserts in 2011, according to a report from Kantar Media, a decline of 6.5 percent from 2010.
lead_paragraph: Advertisers distributed more than 272 billion coupons in free-standing inserts in 2011, according to a report from Kantar Media, part of WPP, a decline of 6.5 percent from 2010. The drop came after two years of increases, of 8 percent in 2009 and 7.2 percent in 2010. The amount of promotion pages from retailers that appeared in the inserts, which are typically carried in Sunday newspapers, rose 30.7 percent last year compared with 2010, the report said; the retailers included Walmart, Dollar General, Target and Walgreens.

headline.main: Accounts and People of Note in the Ad Industry
